message.content: {"responses": [{"question_id": "TT4G35A", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence helps teachers write or improve lesson plans.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35B", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence enables teachers to adapt learning material to different students' abilities.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35C", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence assists teachers in supporting students individually.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35D", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence supports students with specific needs (e.g. multilingual learners, students with special education needs).", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35E", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence helps teachers automate administrative tasks.", "response": "Strongly agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35F", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence enables students to misrepresent others' work as their own.", "response": "Strongly agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35G", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence makes recommendations that may not be appropriate or correct.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35H", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence amplifies biases that reinforce students' misconceptions.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35I", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence jeopardises the privacy and security of student data.", "response": "Strongly agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35J", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence suggests unsuitable pedagogical approaches that teachers would use with students.", "response": "Agree"}]}
message.reasoning_content:
The user is asking me to respond to a survey about AI in education as if I were a primary or secondary school teacher from Belgium. I need to provide responses to 10 statements about AI in education.

Let me think about reasonable responses from the perspective of a teacher:

TT4G35A: AI helps teachers write or improve lesson plans - This is reasonable. Many AI tools can help generate lesson plan ideas. I'd say "Agree"

TT4G35B: AI enables teachers to adapt learning material to different students' abilities - This is possible with AI-powered adaptive learning systems. "Agree"

TT4G35C: AI assists teachers in supporting students individually - AI can help with personalized feedback and support. "Agree"

TT4G35D: AI supports students with specific needs (multilingual, special education) - AI tools can help with translation, text-to-speech, etc. "Agree"

TT4G35E: AI helps teachers automate administrative tasks - AI can definitely help with grading, scheduling, attendance, etc. "Strongly agree"

TT4G35F: AI enables students to misrepresent others' work as their own - This is a legitimate concern with tools like ChatGPT. A teacher would likely acknowledge this is a real risk. "Agree" or "Strongly agree"

TT4G35G: AI makes recommendations that may not be appropriate or correct - AI tools are not infallible and can make errors or inappropriate suggestions. "Agree"

TT4G35H: AI amplifies biases that reinforce students' misconceptions - This is a known issue with AI trained on biased data. "Agree"

TT4G35I: AI jeopardises the privacy and security of student data - There are legitimate privacy concerns with AI systems collecting student data. "Agree" or "Strongly agree"

TT4G35J: AI suggests unsuitable pedagogical approaches - This is possible if AI doesn't understand context or individual student needs. "Agree"

I should provide balanced responses that reflect both the benefits and risks of AI in education. Let me provide thoughtful, realistic teacher perspectives.
